title: Datalist: Autocomplete Inputs
description: Provide suggestions for text inputs without JavaScript

lessons.title: Input with Suggestions
lessons.description:
The <datalist> element provides autocomplete suggestions for inputs. Connect it using the list attribute on the input matching the datalist's id.

Users can still type freely - suggestions are just helpers!
lessons.task:
Create a browser selector:
1. Add a <label> saying 'Browser:'
2. Add an <input> with list="browsers"
3. Add a <datalist id="browsers"> with options for Chrome, Firefox, and Safari
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: system-ui; padding: 20px; } label { display: block; margin-bottom: 8px; font-weight: 500; } input { width: 100%; padding: 10px; border: 1px solid #ccc; border-radius: 6px; font-size: 16px; } input:focus { outline: 2px solid #1976d2; border-color: transparent; }
lessons.initialCode: <!-- Create an input with datalist suggestions -->
lessons.solution:
<label for="browser">Browser:</label>
<input type="text" id="browser" list="browsers">
<datalist id="browsers">
  <option value="Chrome">
  <option value="Firefox">
  <option value="Safari">
</datalist>

validations.message: Connect the input to datalist using <kbd>list=</kbd>"browsers"
Add at least 3 <option> elements inside datalist

lessons.title: Country Selector
lessons.description:
Datalists work great for long lists like countries. Users can type to filter suggestions instantly.

The value attribute is what gets entered, and you can add display text after it.
lessons.task:
Create a country input:
1. Add a <label> saying 'Country:'
2. Add an <input> with list="countries"
3. Add a <datalist id="countries"> with at least 4 country options
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: system-ui; padding: 30px; background: linear-gradient(135deg, #e0f7fa 0%, #b2ebf2 100%); min-height: 100vh; margin: 0; box-sizing: border-box; } label { display: block; margin-bottom: 10px; font-weight: 600; color: #00695c; } input { width: 100%; padding: 12px 15px; border: 2px solid #26a69a; border-radius: 8px; font-size: 16px; background: white; } input:focus { outline: none; border-color: #00695c; box-shadow: 0 0 0 3px rgba(38,166,154,0.2); }
lessons.initialCode: <!-- Create a country selector with datalist -->
lessons.solution:
<label for="country">Country:</label>
<input type="text" id="country" list="countries" placeholder="Start typing...">
<datalist id="countries">
  <option value="Germany">
  <option value="France">
  <option value="Spain">
  <option value="Italy">
</datalist>
